item.title: Report X-2024091833
item.description:
Report X-2024091833

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-29T09:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Undeclared spill. Two 1-gallon metal cans of PPG 7-Line LV Alkyd paint leaked due to lids opening. Approx 1 gallon spilled. Labels damaged on remaining cans. Lids shipped with plastic rings, but no clips. Outer carton not significantly damaged other than from internal leakage. Flashpoint 84.2 F. No hazmat markings.

item.title: Report X-2024091794
item.description:
Report X-2024091794

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-29T09:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=407039768880 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Unloading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1263 CLASS=30 QTY UOM=Liquid - Pint PSN TEXT=Paint PKG GRP=II SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=1 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Quart MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=4 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=1 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Quart )Undeclared spill. Carton containing two 1-qt metal cans of KD3001 sealer, one 1-qt KBC03 basecoat, and two 8 oz metal cans of KDA3000 hardener. Cans shipped in larger box w/insufficient dunnage. All cans dented. Both KD3001 cans leaked, approximately .5 pint spilled. Crushed carton. No hazmat markings. KD3001 and KBC03 flashpoints below 100 F, KDA3000 flashpoint 100.4 F.

item.title: Report X-2024091732
item.description:
Report X-2024091732

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-29T09:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the OAKH location a shipment was found with signs of a release. While investigating the shipment the spill agent found a single can of spray paint UN1950. There was no DG marking on the package or paperwork needed for movement. The can of spray paint released all of it's contents inside of the envelope. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location for the FAA.

item.title: Report X-2024091585
item.description:
Report X-2024091585

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-29T09:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-24
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor II Lloyd Conner contacted safety to report a Hazardous Spill. Lloyd stated that they were unloading trailer 570971 when they noticed a pallet that was damaged and leaking onto the trailer floor. Lloyd stated that the pallet contained 5-gallon pails of UN1760, Corrosive liquids, n.o.s., (Potassium hydroxide and ethanolamine solutions, 8, PG II. Lloyd stated that another pallet was loaded on top of the pallet containing the 5-gallon pails and crushed one of the pails on the bottom resulting in a spillage on the trailer floor and the dock plate. Lloyd stated that he set a pe rimeter around the spill and the back of the trailer. Lloyd stated that no waterways were impacted. Safety contacted CURA and spoke with Brandon Baumann for remediation. ~

The damaged drum was collected and containerized into one (1) 95-gallon overpack. All impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site.   • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 18, 2024, four (4) 1-gallon jugs of UN3149 were damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed sodium bicarbonate and absorbents pads to neutralize and remediate the impacted trailer. All unaffected product was re-stacked and re-wrapped and staged onsite for further processing and shipping. The damaged containers of product were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum

item.title: Report E-2024090567
item.description:
Report E-2024090567

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-29T09:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-17
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 17, 2024, four (4) 5-gallon cans of UN3098 were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbent pads, a Hudson Sprayer, Sodium Metabisulfite, and Soda Ash to remediate the impacted trailer interior and loading dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 95-gallon overpack and two (2) 55-gallon drums. R+L requested for the crew to return later in the day. Three (3) additional 5-gallon jerrycans of product were damaged with approximately one half (0.5) gallon of product released to the pallet, nearby freight, and loading dock floor. Sodium Metabisulfite, and Soda Ash were utilized to remediate the site. The spent absorbents were then collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCN experienced a UN1263 Durastar UC Medium Bronze BR4N160B release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3 ounces of product released to an 8 x 4 area of the trailer floor. The seam on the drum was damaged and leaked due to improper loading. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The impacted absorbents and damaged drum were containerized into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2024090535

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-24
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a release of hazardous product, Kem-Tek Pool & Spa Care Swimming Pool Muriatic Acid. A Contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 1-gallon release of product onto the wooden trailer floor and the concrete beneath the trailer in a 12x4 area on both surfaces. It appears as though the release is a result of dunnage. The contractor neutralized the release using sodium bicarbonate. The damaged/impacted bottles of product were containerized into one 30-gallon DF for waste disposal. The impacted and neutralized pallet pieces, oil dry, PPE, cardboard, and absorbent pads were containerized into two 30-gallon DFs for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste generated from the emergency response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: BATTLE CREEK
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 13, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3082 was punctured by a forklift and shipped, resulting in approximately ten (10) gallons of product being released to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the trailer. All impacted absorbents and the damaged drum were collected and containerized in one (1) 85-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024091720
item.description:
Report X-2024091720

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-B. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART AND DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE AUXILARY/VENT CAP ON A 5-GAL POLY PAIL WAS LOOSE BY A FULL ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID PRODUCT TO SPILL THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 350 LBS PER SQ INCH BURSTING TEST.

item.title: Report E-2024090565
item.description:
Report E-2024090565

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDM experienced a UN1760 GF Clean 1052 release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of product released. The drum was damaged because of improper securement as the drums were not properly strapped to the pallet and shifted off it. The material impacted an 8' x 8' area of the trailer floor and a 11' x 6' area of the concrete lot below. Absorbents & sodium bicarb were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. The damaged drum was containerized into a 95-gallon poly overpack. All impacted absorbents and debris were placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: MADISON

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 17, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1139 was damaged in a load shift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1139-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents, cleanup debris, and one damaged/empty 5-gallon pail were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.description:

  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 17, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1791 was punctured by a pallet and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the trailer interior and the concrete beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and a neutralizing agent to remediate the UN1791-impacted trailer and concrete. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon overpack all impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums.

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: MEMPHIS

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=778393819080 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Loading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1950 CLASS=21 QTY UOM=Gas - Milliliter PSN TEXT=Aerosols, flammable PKG GRP=N/A SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=500 CONTAINER UOM=Gas - Milliliter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=4 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=400 TOTAL UOM=Gas - Milliliter )Two fiberboard boxes of a nineteen pieces shipment showed signs of a release at the MEMH location. Each box contained one Hazmat pad for padding. One of the fiberboard boxes had four large clear Ziploc bags filled with fifty tiny bottles per bag. Four bottles in one bag leaked their contacts from the top caps of the bottles. The 2nd box contained twelve spray cans, eleven smaller spray cans, and one large clear Ziploc bag filled with fifty tiny bottles. Four bottles in one bag leaked their contacts from the top caps of the bottles. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Description: On September 13, 2024, two (2) 50-pound drums of UN3084 were damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE placed two (2) damaged 50 gallon drums into two (2) 95-gallon overpacks. All unaffected freight was then restacked and rewrapped for future terminal shipping. A HEPA vacuum unit was used to retain any loose product from the dock floor. All debris and waste were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum which was staged onsite for future disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2024090519

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-09
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 9, 2024, at 1148 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Charlotte, North Carolina regarding the release of Champion Muriatic Acid. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1 gallon of Champion Muriatic Acid (UN1789, Hydrochloric Acid, 8, II) from (1) 1-gallon poly jug. The release was caused by a multi vehicle accident and impacted the cardboard packaging of other cargo, the trailer floor, and a 1ft x 5ft area of asphalt beneath the trailer. The local fire department solidified the release in the trailer, then contractors neutralized the asphalt, the trailer floor, and the impacted cardboard boxes. The undamaged cargo inside impacted boxes were unboxed, then wrapped and repalletized. Contractors then cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DFs and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.description:

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a release of hazardous product, Setup 6SL. Four plastic jugs inside of two boxes became crushed by the weight of the freight on top of it. This caused a 10-gallon release of product onto the concrete dock floor in a 1x2 area. A contractor neutralized the release using sodium bicarbonate and overpacked the leaking and impacted product. Two drums of waste were generated: (1) 95-gallon DF containing overpacked product and (1) 55-gallon DF containing impacted cardboard, shrink wrap, PPE, and sodium bicarbonate. XPO will manage the waste disposal of the two drums. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • Description: A semi truck tipped over, hitting a reflector post while taking NB Highway 52 ramp from WB Interstate 90. The incident was reported to the authorities and an emergency response team was called to help. Bay West field staff arrived on site and checked with Olmstead County Hazmat Team and Rochester Fire. A safety briefing was held prior to any assessment or cleanup activities began. Two field staff suited up in level B PPE to make and initial assessment of the spill. During the initial incident assessment, the semi truck was observed to have overturned onto its side on the Hwy 52 Northbound ramp. The totes and drums within the trailer were flipped from their original position and were sitting with the openings resting on the roof of the trailer. The contents of some of the containers were observed to be still leaking onto the trailer and running out into the vegetation within the right of the way. A large plume of vapor was observed exiting a hole within the roof of the trailer due to a reaction from the chemicals. (It is believed that the vapor was from the non-hazmat products). Entry into the trailer was made to collect PH sample from the products on the floor, assess damage to the containers, and take an inventory of the contents. Due to the products still gassing, causing a plume of vapor, a confined space fan was set up to vent out the trailer while staff were working. After the initial assessment was conducted, a cleanup plan was made to pump out and transfer the container into new totes. Field Staff began setting up and prepares to transfer the remaining product from the containers. Two staff made entry into the trailer and began to make openings into the hydrogen peroxide totes so a stinger pipe could be used to reach the bottom. Once all of the hydrogen peroxide totes were transferred, 55 gallons of water were flushed through the hoses and pump to decontaminate it before moving onto the next product. After the flush, field staff continued the same process to the remaining products within the trailer until all the totes were empty. A second crew arrived on site to relieve the initial response crew. A safety briefing was conducted along with a discussion about the remaining work prior to the first crew mobilizing off site. The second crew began with recovering and overpacking the remaining drums within the trailer. Four drums were still intact, three of the drums were observed to be compromised and damaged, and one drum was empty. The three compromised drums were overpacked and prepared for transport. Once all of the drums were removed, absorbent pads were used to recover any remaining product from the trailer. After all of the product was removed from the trailer, a wrecking crew arrived to upright the semi and move it off site to their storage yard. All of the drums and the waste product that was transferred into totes was delivered to a MnDOT facility in Stewartville until disposal could be arranged. The total transferred product tota

item.title: Report I-2024090053
item.description:
Report I-2024090053

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-24
  • City: Tucson
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: About 30 minutes after take off from ORD passenger Richard Grelson advised the flight crew he dropped his phone because it was getting hot in his pocket. The flight attendant then got the fire containment bag and retrieved the phone and placed it in the fire thermal runaway bag for the remainder of the flight. The CA called into TUS to advise about the overheated phone. Upon meeting the aircraft, CSM retrieved the bag from the flight attendant. The phone was no longer over heated and was then returned to the customer after deplaning the aircraft. Passenger Richard was sitting in 14e. We were in the middle of the service when he told me that his phone was hot. I asked if it was just charging and he said no it was in his pocket and the phone wasn't working. I immediately grabbed the phone and grabbed the fire containment bag. After putting the phone in the bag I took it and put it in the cart in the aft galley. I then asked passenger Richard what happened before the flight and he said he dropped the phone before boarding the flight and the phone turned off and didn't work after that. He thought it was ok. Then his phone started to get hot in his pocket. I told the captain everything. Then the csm took it once we were fully deplaned in Tucson.

  • City: Portland

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At PDX, on 8/19/2024, Delta's Dangerous Goods Management team received an incident report where a shipment that contained dry ice was transported from LAX to PDX undeclared. The courier whom picked up the packages stated there was 20 kg of dry ice per container. However, there was no dry ice statement on the air waybill, no Special Handling Code(SPL) entries or NOTOC produced for the flight. Additionally, there were no labels or markings indicating dry ice on the packages. The description noted in the cargo booking system states,"empty Packaging, comat non haz". This event is under investigation.

  • Description: At ATL, on 08/19/2024, the SAFRAN Garden Grove Repair Station received, from Delta Airlines a P/N D29982-225 Pass Slide EVAC RO# 4701481897 by truck which is a Dangerous Good commodity(UN2990). The freight wasn't identified as a dangerous good with the correct markings for a DG shipment. The receiving team opened the freight only to discover that a DG item was inside of the wooden cart. This package was not shipped by air transportation. The truck loading lanes containing DG and non-DG were next to each other leading to the mix up of shipments. This event remains under investigation.

THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. SUPPLEMENTAL REPORT BEING SUBMITTED TO VOID THE 5800 FOR AN INCORRECTLY REPORTED UNDECLARED PACKAGE. MOPAR HAZMAT DANGEROUS GOODS CONFIRMED THIS PRODUCT SHIPS UNDER 49CFR 173.306(F)(4). THE PACKAGE WAS NOT REQUIRED TO HAVE HAZMAT CLASSIFICATION LABELS, MARKS, SHIPPING PAPER, OR UN SPECIFICATION PACKAGING TO SHIP THE PRODUCT ALSO MEETS IATA REGULATIONS SPECIAL PROVISION All4. item.description:
Report X-2024091539

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-26T09:22:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City:
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/20/2024 at approximately 1600, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 3871364 at the ramp facility in Mirabel, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. Local security procedure led to the discovery of this shipment via x-ray. The shipment consisted of varying nonhazardous personal items, among these were found a box of safety matches. The package was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The shipment is currently being held, pending an FAA investigation.

  • Description: On Sept 19th a package was found during the PM sort that was leaking. The package contained twelve one quart cans of UN1263 Paint, 3, PGIII. One of the cans had the lid come loose and the lock ring did not keep it sealed allowing the liquid to leak out of the can. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is pending disposition.

  • Description: On 9/13/2024 at approximately 1945, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 423023 at the station location in Boston, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of 2 metal cans packaged in a fiberboard box. The shipment appeared to have been damaged due to mishandling, resulting in spillage. The shipment was labeled as Ground Limited Quantity, and improperly prepared for air transport. The shipment will be sent for proper hazardous disposal.

The bucket was taken to the spill office where the looked up the SDS and the product was classified as a UN2922. The bucket did not have any DG markings or paperwork needed for transportation. The bucket was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held for the FAA.

  • Description: Patriot Environmental Services was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft- by-3ft area of the trailer floor and concrete lot and estimated that one (1) cup of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 1-gallon metal pail. Patriot Environmental Services personnel used absorbent pads to recover the released material. Two (2) pails of , and the product could not be removed therefore these two (2) pails along with the one (1) damaged pail were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite. The waste will remain onsite until the waste profile has been completed and approved for transport for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090509
item.description:
Report E-2024090509

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-25T09:22:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 13, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior, exterior, and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the trailer and on the pavement outside and swept them up with hand tools. Crews wiped down the impacted areas with absorbent pads, hand tools, and degrease. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Tthe damaged pails of paint were collected and containerized into one (1) other 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024090510
item.description:
Report E-2024090510

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-25T09:22:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 13, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of GreenClean PRO was damaged by a forklift and released approximately four (4) pounds of product to the loading dock floor, shrink wrap, and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel collected the damaged bag of product, and impacted shrink wrap, for disposal. Crews utilized hand tools to collect the released material from the impacted areas. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly, vented drum which was staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-11
  • City: BOISE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 11, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of ferric nitrate was damaged in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Clean Harbors (CH) to remediate the impacted site. CH personnel deployed granular absorbents and worked them in with hand tools. The crew then performed a gravity transfer into one (1) 75-gallon tote for continued shipment. All impacted material and PPE were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 11, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1139 was damaged in transit due to unknown reasons and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and gravel beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. personnel deployed oil dry to the impacted area and worked it in with hand tools, a berm was put in place to prevent further migration of any material, during the duration of the continued to transport. All absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. On September 12, 2024, additional granular absorbents were deployed and they worked them in with hand tools. All remaining product was collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

  • Description: On 9/9/24 rail car GIMX516236 arrived at the facility with 2 IBC containers that were found leaking material onto the rail car. Absorbent were put down and a crew was call out to address the release. The crew arrived and added containments pans under the area that was leaking and more absorbent was applied. The crew need more equipment and returned on 9/1/24 at 0900. They added more absorbents to the containers to absorb any free liquids that were left and addressed the container doors checking the seals and retightening them. The crew then cleaned the rail car and the outside of the boxes. They were completed and leaving the scene at 1630.

item.description:
Report X-2024091408

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-24T09:21:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: LAS VEGAS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/20/2024 at approximately 1011 Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 817392 at the staion location in Las Vegas, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of one plastic container packaged in a fiberboard box. The shipment was discovered leaking from the bottom of the box. Further investigation revealed the plastic container contained iron, steel, nickel blackener and it spilled from the closure. An online safety data sheet classifed this commodity as UN3264 ; however, the shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the markings, labels, packaging and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

ABF RPS stated that if they had loaded it correctly at the origin terminal, the freight wouldn't have rubbed up against the wall and spilled. ABF Safety advised RPS to block off the trailer until CURA has serviced it. CURA has been notified and dispatched to the terminal on emergency response. ABF advi sed RPS to send pictures to Safety.

  • Description: On September 1st a package was found during the PM sort a package was found leaking. The package was opened and four cans of IPE Oil Deck Stain were found, with two of those cans leaking from the lids being opened. An SDS confirmed that this shipment is UN1263 Paint, 3, PGIII. There were no markings or indications on the outside of the package indicating that it contained and dangerous goods. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is being held pending disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024080719
item.description:
Report E-2024080719

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-24T09:21:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-26
  • City: NORTH CHARLESTON
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 08/26/2024, at 0820 hours, personnel in the CSXT Bennett Yard discovered GATX 6644, a loaded tank car of Sulfuric Acid, leaking from the top of the tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Southern States Chemical Inc, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-08-26-00040. HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found that the retainer cap, rupture disk and surge protector were missing from the safety vent of the tank car. Contractor personnel installed a surge protector, rupture disk and disc retainer, as well as decontaminated the top and sides of the rail car. The issue was identified, and corrective actions, were communicated to the shippers representative (Clay Hester, 912-944-7107). Emergency response efforts secured the car from leaking; it was held at location pending additional work by a certified tank car repair facility that could performed a qualified repaired.

item.title: Report E-2024090421
item.description:
Report E-2024090421

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: MASPETH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer, material handler discovered a plastic drum that had fallen over due to improper preparation for transportation. Apparently, when the drum fell over a small crack developed on the bottom as a result of the drum getting pinched on the pallet it was staged on when it fell over that consequently contributed to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the cracked drum.

  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS FULLY MARKED AND LABELED AS DANGEROUS GOODS, UN1263 PAINT, WITH APPROPRIATE SHIPPING PAPERS. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED FOUR X ONE GALLON PAINT CANS. THREE PAINT CANS ARE LEAKING FROM THEIR CLOSURE. ONE GALLON REMAINED INTACT. THE PACKAGE AND DANGEROUS GOODS CONTENTS HAVE BEEN DISPOSED OF PER NORMAL DANGEROUS GOODS DISPOSAL PROCEDURES.

item.title: Report E-2024090464
item.description:
Report E-2024090464

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-17
  • City: LITHONIA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On September 17, 2024, at 1141 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Lithonia, Georgia regarding the release of NALCO BT-3011 BOILER WATER TREATMENT. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 260 gallons of Nalco BT-3011 Boiler Water Treatment (Sodium Hydroxide Solution, UN1824, 8, III) from (1) IBC plastic tote. The release was caused by a puncture and impacted the trailer floor, and multiple small areas of concrete as the trailer was in motion, that were unrecoverable. The residual material in the damaged tote was neutralized and solidified with absorbents, the damaged tote was cut up, then the trailer was neutralized and cleaned. Contractors also confirmed a 1ft x 6inch area of soil was impacted. Contractors were able to collect the impacted soil without complication. All waste was containerized in (4) 55-gallon DFs and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024091327
item.description:
Report X-2024091327

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-17
  • City: Bloomington
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Tank car CGTX 31178 was found in the West Colton Yard in Bloomington, CA with diesel down the sides of the tank car and between the manway and the combination housing. After assessment it was determined that the manway swing bolts were over tightened causing the manway to be misaligned, also, the safety eye bolt was offset/bowed from being over torqued causing product to release. The manway gasket was inspected, and no issues where found. The tank car manway was reset, and the swing bolts were secured properly. Contractor cleaned off all diesel impacted areas on the tank car.

item.title: Report E-2024090447
item.description:
Report E-2024090447

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-16
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 16, 2024, at 1055 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Los Angeles, California regarding the release of Methylene Chloride. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 30 gallons of Methylene Chloride (Dichloromethane, UN1593, 6.1, IIII) from (1) 55-gallon DM. The release was caused by a puncture and impacted a pallet and an area of the trailer floor. Contractors placed the damaged drum in an overpack and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DM, and (1) 85-gallon plastic overpack, then staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090443
item.description:
Report E-2024090443

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: HEBRON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 13, 2024, at 1111 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Hebron, Ohio regarding the release of STRONTIUM CHROMATE 176. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1 pound of Strontium Chromate 176 (UN3077, 9, III) from (1) 1000 lb. supersack. The release was caused by a collapsed pallet and impacted a 1ft x 6ft area of the trailer floor. Contractors were able to successfully patch the hole in the punctured supersack then placed it in a lined gaylord. The release was collected with the proper PPE and placed in a metal drum. Another supersack that was undamaged but was on top of a collapsed pallet was also placed into a lined gaylord as a precaution. All cargo was unloaded, unwrapped, restacked and rewrapped onto new pallets before being reloaded onto the trailer. All waste was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DMs and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

  • Description: On September 11, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon pail of paint was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the impacted site. ES&H personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged pail were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 11, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3066 had a loose cap and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN3066-impacted trailer. The damaged pail and all impacted waste was collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon drums. Fifteen (15) additional pails were severely impacted and, per R+L, were palletized and gift wrapped. The waste drums and pallet of impacted pails were staged onsite for transport and disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 10, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of printer ink was punctured in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior, under cage, and roadway beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the site. EWI Scraped the inside of the trailer using hand tools and degreaser. crews placed absorbents on the trailer floor to soak up all degreaser. The gravel underneath the trailer was shoveled using hand tools until no product was left on the ground. With approval from R+L the driver was sent to the St. Louis, MO, Terminals wash bay to remediate the exterior of the trailer. All spent absorbents, as well as any damaged drums were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum which was taken back to the Springfield, MO, R+L terminal where it was staged for future disposal

item.title: Report E-2024090491
item.description:
Report E-2024090491

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN1133 UltraPly Bonding Adhesive release from a 5-gallon metal pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5 x 5 area of the trailer floor and an 8 x 2 area of the concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged pail and cleanup debris were containerized into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090446
item.description:
Report E-2024090446

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 17000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At 23:00 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NNA. It was reported that approximately 137.5 gallons of UN3266 Natural HDPE FCL13 released from a plastic tote due to a pole on another piece of freight puncturing the tote during the unloading process. The release impacted inside of trailer #3153521 and asphalt. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 180-gallons of product released to a 300-yard x 400-yard are of the asphalt lot as well as the trailer floor. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The remaining material in the tote was transferred into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized. All impacted absorbents and the cut up poly tote were then containerized into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 03:19 EST on 8/29, XPO-XSL contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 2 ounces of UN2078 "Solithane S 113" from a 1gal metal pail impacting the trailer floor. The pail was damaged during loading by XKC. ERTS confirmed the material to be hazard class 6.1. ERTS dispatched contractors for cleanup, however XPO terminal personnel decided to complete cleanup in house. Contractor response was canceled. XPO terminal personnel donned PPE and containerized the damaged pail and 3 other pails of the material into a 10-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 1443ET, XPO notified ERTS of a pressurized canister hissing and frozen over on top at terminal XMP. It was reported that the hissing was consistent and getting heavier. ERTS advised we can send a contractor to check the valve, XPO moved trailer to the yard away from the dock, kept the trailer door opened and monitored the situation. The cylinder off-gassed and a contractor was not dispatched. No waste was generated.

item.title: Report X-2024091222
item.description:
Report X-2024091222

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-25
  • City: MACON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8.25.24 E. Austin was notified of a potential release from UTLX 959328 inside Brosnan Yard. There was visible icing of the housing and a strong smell of Propane around the car. Appropriate PPE was donned, and the car was mounted. Once the housing was opened and Ice removed, it was determined that the Liquid Line Valve was open, and the Liquid Line Plug was loose. Both were tightened, effectively stopping the release. Pressure was measured at 175 PSI and there was 19in. of outage in the car.
